events.message: We have successfully received your application for the Software Engineer position. Thank you for your interest and we will review your qualifications shortly.
Your application has been categorized under the Engineering department, specifically for the software developer role, based on the skills and experience you have listed.
A recruiter specializing in engineering roles has been assigned to your application and will be your point of contact throughout the hiring process.
We have completed the initial screening of your resume and qualifications. Your profile matches the basic requirements and we would like to proceed to the next step.
Thank you for your quick response and confirming your availability for the upcoming interviews. We appreciate your enthusiasm.
Your technical interview has been scheduled for May 10th at 3:00 PM UTC. Please prepare to discuss your experience with software development and problem-solving.
The technical interview was successfully completed. Your problem-solving skills and software engineering knowledge were impressive to the panel.
We have scheduled the HR interview for May 15th at 11:00 AM UTC. This will cover topics such as culture fit, work preferences, and benefits.
The HR interview has concluded positively. Our HR team found you to be a great cultural match for our engineering team and company values.
We are pleased to propose you an offer for the Software Engineer role including competitive salary and benefits. Please review the offer details sent via email.
We have received your positive feedback on the offer and are happy to hear you are excited to join our engineering team.
You have officially accepted our offer. We are thrilled to welcome you aboard as a new Software Engineer in our company.
Your onboarding process has started. You will receive all necessary information and access to get you set up for your first day as an engineer.
The hiring process is now complete. We are excited to have you join our Engineering team and look forward to your contributions.
